undercover: ^Oi! Quiet down when speaking to me like that! It's Mr. Patrick Cox the barbershop inspector to you.
reason: ^How's business been. I trust that you are doing your duties well as an Emissary of Hair.

c-0: ^I uh... I sold the last wig I had on hand earlier today.

manners: ^Oi! Watch your manners before I show you what happens when you don't.
^I have come here today to do a routine inspection to make sure you're doing your duties well as an Emissary of Hair.

c-0: ^I uh... I sold the last wig I had on hand earlier today.

shock: ^You... You're high enough in the Emissaries of Hair to open your own barbershop in hopes of collecting hair for the cult. But you don't even have any wigs.
^What's even the point of having you running this undercover business then.

s: ^Look I uh... Just needed more time to really blend in before I could start Sacrificing customers like the others.

disbelief: ^More time?! What about the guy who just left with a below par haircut huh?

s: ^He was being difficult and I thought it was the best way to deal with it.

pushover: ^I think it's cause you're a pushover. And pushovers don't run undercover facilities. I'm gonna have to take away your business privileges and find someone else to run this place. We'll rename it too.
